712611f-a.text:
(1)
40th Street,north side, west from and including Second Avenue.
July 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a low roof east of Second avenue. Notice the progress that has been made in a month's time on the Lefcourt Colonial Building and the Lincoln Building.
August 16,1929.
P. L. Sperr.

712609f-b.text:
1.
E 40th St, north side, east of 2nd Ave, as seen thru clearance on the south side of 40th St (former site of nos. 308-312). Prominent bldgs shown are the Hotel Tudor (304 E 42nd St)and the Woodstock Tower (320 E 42nd St).
Sept. 11, 1931

2.
A closer view. No. 313 is not shown, as the rear of no. 314 restricts the view.
Sept. 11, 1931

707873f-a.text:
Second Avenue, front of 9893-895 car track area.
President Borough of Manhattan.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE .  April 26, 1921.

712610f-a.text:
East 40th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue. Outstanding is one of the Tudor City units at First Avenue. View 2 is photographed northward from the new roadway that leads to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel.
June 7, 1940
October 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr
